intro: Pilosella tardiuscula subsp. microvasconica, commonly known as the small-veined hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, yellow composite flowers and hairy stems, typical of the Pilosella genus. The subspecies is native to southern Europe and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and blooms from late spring to early autumn.
